title: Champion Response
body: I have had issues in-game, with my champion not responding to my movement commands/spells, this is not due to lag or fps, every other player in the game plays normally, and on discord I am heard just fine, getting along 30-40 ms with over 70 FPS. Sometimes, when I'm in a fight I just stand there and I can't move or do spells, but I can see the green arrows when I click to move but my champ just doesn't move, sometimes I can stand there for 5 seconds up to 30 seconds, which is a long time when you're in lane. I know some people have already had this problem, but that was 4-5 years ago, and some of the ones I had seen had no solution. I was wondering if anyone is having the same problem? I also posted this here because I can't make a support ticket, because it keeps saying I need to log in, even though I am as you can see. I have died a lot to this issue.

replies.body:
There are some additional steps we can take to help troubleshoot this issue.

To me, it sounds like it could still be a connection issue, even with that 99/100 on the lag report. Just in case if you haven't yet, this [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664) is a great guide to start troubleshooting what could be causing this issue.

If those steps didn't help solve it, [submitting a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to our Tech team would be the next step. From there, they can do some more troubleshooting and provide more assistance. Just make sure to give them as much information as possible!

I've experienced this before, and for me personally, it was a packet loss issue. Here's a copy of my reply to someone who had a similar issue:

You could upload your game logs to the [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) and see if you're having any issues with packet loss. On the bottom of that page, there is also a [lag report](http://lagreport.com/) link to give you an idea of your ISP's connection to their servers, and how your connection compares to your ISP's. It will also show you which ISP has the best connection for your area.

Some people have also mentioned that moving LoL from their SSD to their HDD seemed to have fixed the issue for them.
